quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to make a valid case expression for the status variable.
[!raw!]
status = 1

{0} status
when 1
  puts "Online"
{1} 2
  puts "Offline"
{2}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]case Statements[/h1]

As we have seen in the previous lessons, we can check for multiple conditions using the [b]if/elsif/else[/b] expression. 
A more simplified and flexible option is the [b]case [/b]expression, which tests a value in [b]when [/b]statements.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" codeId="1000"]a = 2

[b]case [/b]a
[b]when [/b]1
  puts "One"
[b]when [/b]2
  puts "Two"
[b]when [/b]3
  puts "Three"
[b]end[/b]

# outputs "Two"[/code]
[note]You can have as many [b]when [/b]statements as you need for a single [b]case[/b].
Note that the [b]case [/b]expression must be closed with the [b]end [/b]keyword.[/note]

quizzes.question:
What is the output of this code?
x = 8
case x
when 7, 8
  puts x+1
when 5, 6
  puts x-1
end
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]case Statements[/h1]

Multiple values can be tested within a single [b]when [/b]by separating the values with [b]commas[/b].
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" codeId="1001"]age = 5

case age
when 1, 2, 3
  puts "Little baby"
when 4, 5
  puts "Child"
end

# outputs "Child"[/code]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to construct a valid case statement.
[!raw!]
weight = 4
case weight
{0} 1, 2, 3
  puts "Low"
when 4, 5, 6
  puts "High"
{1}
  puts "Invalid"
{2}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]case Statements[/h1]

An [b]else [/b]statement can be provided to execute code if no [b]when [/b]condition matches: [code format="rb" codeId="1002"]age = 18

case age
when 1, 2, 3
  puts "Little baby"
when 4, 5
  puts "Child"
[b]else[/b]
  puts "Not a baby"
end

# outputs "Not a baby"[/code]
[note]Case statements allow us to more easily control program flow. If statements should always be used to determine if a conditional is true, and case statements are for when you need to make different decisions based on a value.[/note]
